what_is_esim.title: What is eSIM?
what_is_esim.description: An eSIM (embedded SIM) is a digital SIM card built into your device that can be programmed to work with different mobile carriers. Unlike traditional SIM cards, eSIMs are non-removable and can store multiple carrier profiles.
what_is_esim.benefits: eSIMs offer several advantages: instant activation, no physical SIM card needed, ability to switch between carriers easily, and support for multiple numbers on a single device.

device_support.question: Which devices support eSIM?
device_support.answer: Most smartphones released since 2018 support eSIM technology. This includes iPhone XS and newer, Samsung Galaxy S20 and newer, Google Pixel 3 and newer, and many other Android devices. Check our compatibility checker above for specific device support.

activation.question: How do I activate an eSIM?
activation.answer: eSIM activation is typically done through your device's settings. You'll receive a QR code or activation code from your carrier, which you scan or enter in your device's eSIM settings. The process varies slightly between iOS and Android devices.

benefits.question: What are the benefits of eSIM?
benefits.answer: eSIMs offer instant activation, no need to carry physical SIM cards, easy switching between carriers, support for multiple numbers on one device, and are more secure than physical SIMs.
